fields.summary: Upgrade STP (support tools plugin) to 3.0.9

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29038].
  {panel}

As a subcontractor for DirecTV, we interact with JIRA many times per day.  Here are some suggestions for improvements, which are supported by DirecTV:

1. It's annoying that sub-tasks can't have sub-tasks.  Sub-tasks of sub-tasks should be allowed.  Further, there should be a list in tasks (and sub-tasks) showing what sub-tasks they have.

2. When email goes to jirahddvr@directv.com, with a recognizable ticket in the subject, JIRA forwards the email to the assignee for the ticket.  Helpfully, it checks to see if the assignee is the same as the sender of the email, and in that case, it does not forward the email.  It should also check the Cc: list of the email to see if the assignee is on the list, and in that case it should also not forward the email.

3. JIRA believes that two issues can be linked as "is related to", "is related by", "duplicates", or "is duplicated by".  There is no semantic difference between "is related to" and "is related by" because "is related to" is a symmetric relation (and so is "duplicates").  JIRA should get rid of "is related by" and "is duplicated by".                                       -- George
fields.summary: Subtasks need subtasks; related/duplicated should be symmetric; less email
Provide the ability to display the release date as a column in the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29036].
  {panel}

I would take some more questions about the export and import of
information, because
I believe that this is a very important point for the use of Jira in the
cloud. At some point we need to migrate information from our facilities to
the cloud and vice versa. How can we make this data migration?
fields.summary: Migrating database JIRA site for cloud
Saving filter that contain invalid user should be perform faster
Indexing should skip the non-existing users to improve the speed
Allow easy markups to link other JIRA artefacts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29029].
  {panel}

I have the following two use cases and especially the activity log and activity stream are giving me a hard time right now:

o I use custom listeners to copy estimates into linked issues and copy comments into parent issues
o I use workflow transitions that transition to the same status to execute post functions (e.g. copy an issue to another project)

Whenever I use any one of those, I end up with a lot of unuseful entries showing up in the activity stream, e.g.

o The original comment + another entry for the copied comment
o Messages that User A opened a ticket (actually he transitioned the issue from Open to Open)
o and so on

What I really need is the ability to change how these changes are represented in the activity log / stream and / or prevent them from showing up at all.
fields.summary: Ability to change / prevent what shows in activity log / stream

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29011].
  {panel}

Customers use GApps to log in and also to manage users in JIRA.
Before the licensing change it was possible to just remove the users from the groups and they would be removed from groups in JIRA and so freeing up licenses again.
Licensing is now managed by application access, which is not changed if users are taken out of groups.
Ideally the new feature would revoke application access when you remove users out of groups in GApps and so automatically free up licenses without the need for the administrator to log in and make the changes manually.
fields.summary: Revoke application access when users are disabled in GApps
Make remove 'None' from custom field to be configurable in jira-config.properties

"Die Seite _Major Release Number existiert nicht" means "this page doesn't exist.

Also, on jira.atlassian.com I get the message "version 5.1 does not exist" when entering 5.1 in the version field.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29006].
  {panel}

If the JIRA context path is set to a value that ends with a "s" then the issue collector breaks.

Eg: "/issues or /defects or etc"

Ref: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/70135/can-issue-collector-work-if-jira-context-path-is-set


Steps to reproduce:
1. Change the context path in server.xml to end with a "s"
2. Start Jira...
3. Create a issue collector can see that it has no field other than NAME and EMAIL.
fields.summary: Issue collector breaks if the context path ends with "s"

fields.description:
Hi
I have two projects (let's call them new and old) with different fields configuration schemas - the newer project has some OPTIONAL custom fields but theese fields are not used in the older project. When I perform a bulk move from the older project to the new one JIRA needs to fill all those custom fields as MANDATORY but they should be OPTIONAL.
fields.summary: Optional-mandatory fields problem when bulk move

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28986].
  {panel}

This new feature was added to the User Directories, as in the attached screenshot. Unfortunately we don't seem to have any documentation on it and it's a bit confusing about what the functionality does and does not do.

So far, based from the case I worked on and JRA-24213 it seems to be able to:
* Migrate *all users* from JIRA Internal to Delegated LDAP.
* Migrate *all users* from Delegated LDAP to JIRA Internal.
* Migrate *all users* from Delegated LDAP to Delegated LDAP.

It does not support (requested in JRA-27868):

* Migrating a specific set of users from one directory to another.
* "Connector" User Directories - so direct to the LDAP Server (e.g.: Active Directory).
* Migrating groups only.

It seems to have the following features:
* If you, the currently logged in user, are in the directory to be migrated from, your user data will not be migrated.
* Users and groups will not be migrated if they already exist in the target directory. For example, if {{dcurrie}} exists in JIRA Internal and JIRA Delegated LDAP, yet has different groups in JIRA Internal, when migrating from one to the other, that user will be skipped an the groups will not be migrated.

And of note:
* Project Roles are not affected as they do not seem to be user directory specific (unlike groups).

This originally derived from JRA-24213 and now has a subsequent issue to add more functionality to the feature, JRA-27868.

Can you please add some documentation for this feature? (it came in as part of 5.0.3 and somehow missed the [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+5.0.3+Release+Notes]).

Thank you!
fields.summary: Please add some documentation for the 'Migrate users from one directory to another' Functionality
Allow global administrators to pose as specific users

fields.description:
I Am installing JIRA 5.1 on an X86 Server. (WS03)

After upgrading from 5.0.5 to 5.1 (which is reported as successful) when I navigat to my jira instance, I get an error stating that Database fields are missing. If I add the fields to the database tables, the load progresses through the tables until it gets to the next set of fields that are missing.

If I were to guess, it looks like the JIRA X86 upgrade package is missing the commands to update the database with required fields needed.

adding -Djira.autoexport=false to the commandline when starting the service does not help. 

Please contact me if you need me to provide logs of the environment and installation.
fields.summary: Standard Upgrade from 5.0.5 to 5.1 fails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28981].
  {panel}

When mail notifications fail or the mail queue is not flushing, it is often not realized until an user notifies the JIRA admin.  This can be hours before something like this is noticed by anyone.

We should implement a notification for when the mail queue is not sending out.

Thoughts on how to do this:
* Maybe a notification on top of administration menus (similar to the index suggestions)
* Maybe just a mail queue counter that is easily visible for admins, this way they'll know when the queue is piling up and higher than usual
fields.summary: Visible Warning if Mail Queue is not being sent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28980].
  {panel}

When attempting to invoke the SOAP procedure 'getIssue', no XML response is received for some issues, resulting in an exception when using Python's SOAPpy and a NULL return value when using Perl's SOAP::Lite.

The problematic issues were identified using the attached SOAPtest.py and SOAPtest.log.

An investigation has determined that all of the issues for which this error occurs contain non-printable characters (in this case, 0xBD, 0xBF, 0xEF).

The characters were most likely introduced inadvertently when text was copied from an e-mail or RTF/Word document.

JIRA should be capable of either (a) stripping out bad characters when text is entered, or (b) correctly stripping or escaping bad characters when generating a SOAP response.

Note that that aggregate-issue SOAP methods (e.g. getIssuesFromJqlSearch, getIssuesFromTextSearchWithLimit) also fail when any issue in which the above problem exists would be included in the returned issue collection.
fields.summary: SOAP: cannot retrieve issue details when non-printable chars present in text fields
JIRA should handle Leap Second gracefully

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28976].

I've filed this issue as per https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/69998/how-to-insert-into-a-comment-a-link-to-a-certain-comment-of-another-issue-without-using-an-absolute-url
Please note I don't want to establish a relationship between two issues... but simply refer to a certain comment (possibly on another issue within the same jira instance).
A link using the comment sequence number would be great. I guess also something similar to [confluence syntax \[$comment-id\]|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-7884] would be enough when you simply want to refer to what has been written into another issue's comment.
Instead, having to provide an absolute URL is not portable at all.
fields.summary: Provide a way to link a comment to another issue's comment

fields.description:
Everytime a ticket is created through incoming email I'm getting bounce back:

This is the mail system at host emx-103-2.ash1.uc-inf.net.

I'm sorry to have to inform you that your message could not
be delivered to one or more recipients. It's attached below.

For further assistance, please send mail to postmaster.

If you do so, please include this problem report. You can
delete your own text from the attached returned message.

                   The mail system

<noreply@atlassian.com>: host atlassian.com.s9a1.psmtp.com[74.125.148.10] said:
    550 No such user - psmtp (in reply to RCPT TO command)

Final-Recipient: rfc822; noreply@atlassian.com
Original-Recipient: rfc822;noreply@atlassian.com
Action: failed
Status: 5.0.0
Remote-MTA: dns; atlassian.com.s9a1.psmtp.com
Diagnostic-Code: smtp; 550 No such user - psmtp
fields.summary: Undelivered Mail Returned to Sender
Application Links configuration page should handle a corrupt entry

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28958].
  {panel}

I understand that there are certain error conditions that JIRA can't really recover from. However, some are common enough that you should be able to catch and display a properly formatted message to the user. Our database server went down recently—and while we are tracking down the cause for it, JIRA should have handled the situation better. There are two different behaviors for a downed database, depending on whether JIRA was running at the time or not.

If JIRA was already running when the database goes down:

We get a stack trace of your code with a final exception saying it can't connect to the database.

If JIRA is also shut down, but started before the database is ready:

JIRA writes it's .lock file
We get a generic Tomcat Error screen with no information, no stacktrace, nothing.
When you shut the JIRA service back down, the .lock file remains

What I would like to see, at least for when the database is down:

A similar page to the case when there is an existing .lock file, but this time telling the user that the database can't be connected to.
Proper cleanup of the .lock file when the service is shut down.
fields.summary: Provide a better error page if you cannot connect to the database.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28957].
  {panel}

Hi,

As suggested/requested by support (GHS-4990), im creating this improvement.
I would not expect the 'Sprint' field to show on the 'Bulk Edit' screen, because:

1.) The field is (default)not shown on any screens, so that 'suggests' that it's not meant to be edited manually (like the ranking)
2.) The descriptions says 'Sprint field for Greenhopper use only', which suggests that only Greenhopper is allowed to edit this field.

Kind regards,

Edwin.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit should not show the 'Sprint' field

fields.description:
QuartzWorker-0 WARN ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] Could not add the following entity to the directory [ Crowd Internal Directory ]: xiaoming.huang

QuartzWorker-0 WARN ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] Could not add the following missing users to group [ 销售平台-销售中心-华中区 ]: [shan.huang]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28953].
  {panel}

It will be great if JIRA have the feature to WARN users if it is running on an unsupported platform/environment. Perhaps the warn message can be appended to the logs file, and users will immediately spot the problem upon checking the logs and fix the issue themselves. 

Sample use case:
- Currently JDK 1.7 is not supported by JIRA 
- If we have the application running with JDK 1.7, a lot of exceptions will be thrown during JIRA startup (e.g.: bundled plugin failed to load, etc)
- Hence, having the feature to warn users that JDK 1.7 (instead of throwing loads of exceptions) during startup may be a good idea
fields.summary: Add the ability to have JIRA warn the users if the application is running on an unsupported environment
While importing users that aren't member of any group, JIRA tries to grant the Default Application Access to them

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28950].
  {panel}

To reproduce this problem:

# Log into an OnDemand instance. 
# Create a project.
# Create a test user with only JIRA Project Admin application access.
# Go to the 'Project Roles' screen of the project you created and add the test user as an 'Administrator' making them a Project Admin.
# Log into the instance as the test user.
# As the test user, navigate to the project admin screen for the project you created.
# Click on the 'Projects' link on the top of the left side-bar.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28941].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

I understand that there are limitations to logging based on log4j and in Tomcat but it is a pain for an Administrator, and for Atlassian support engineers to work with massive logfiles. JIRA should ship with a logging system which has log rotation enabled by default for more than just instance restarts.

h3. Workaround
Choose one them:
* Options to rotate the {{catalina.out}} and detailed steps for using logrotate are documented at [How to Rotate the Catalina Log File|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Rotate+the+Catalina+Log+File].
* Increase logging level for {{console}} loggers to _WARN_ and restart JIRA, see diff:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
diff -u ./atlassian-jira-6.4.13-standalone//atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties  ./log4j.properties
--- ./atlassian-jira-6.4.13-standalone//atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties	2016-02-25 06:10:30.000000000 +0100
+++ ./log4j.properties 	2016-09-26 15:51:16.000000000 +0200
@@ -28,12 +28,12 @@
 #####################################################

 log4j.appender.console=org.apache.log4j.ConsoleAppender
-log4j.appender.console.Threshold=DEBUG
+log4j.appender.console.Threshold=WARN
 log4j.appender.console.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
 log4j.appender.console.layout.ConversionPattern=%d %t %p %X{jira.username} %X{jira.request.id} %X{jira.request.assession.id} %X{jira.request.ipaddr} %X{jira.request.url} [%c{4}] %m%n

 log4j.appender.nowarnconsole=org.apache.log4j.ConsoleAppender
-log4j.appender.nowarnconsole.Threshold=DEBUG
+log4j.appender.nowarnconsole.Threshold=WARN
 log4j.appender.nowarnconsole.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
 log4j.appender.nowarnconsole.layout.ConversionPattern=%d %t %p %X{jira.username} %X{jira.request.id} %X{jira.request.assession.id} %X{jira.request.ipaddr} %X{jira.request.url} [%c{4}] %m%n
{code}
* Remove all {{console}} from log specific logging events, see examples
{code:borderStyle=solid}
-log4j.logger.com.atlassian = WARN, console, filelog
+log4j.logger.com.atlassian = WARN,  filelog
 log4j.additivity.com.atlassian = false
{code}
sed code:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
sed '230,$s/console,//' ./log4j.properties > ./log4j.properties_new
{code}
fields.summary: Ship JIRA with defaults that enable log rotation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28940].
  {panel}

Hello team,

I've noticed that when you run a search through Issue Navigator and select the view "On Dashboard", it will allow you to also add gadgets which aren't filter based, such the GreenHopper Statistics Burndown Chart and it can cause some confusion for users.

Could you please verify if this is possible to only show filters which currently will make use of the search results that you got (maybe creating a new filter, if it is not already created)?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Don't show gadgets which aren't filter-based on view "On Dashboard" of Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28939].
  {panel}

The implementation of JRA-9 only covers the web user interface, but does not appear to extend to emails.  Date fields appearing in notification emails do not honor the user's time zone preference but instead show the server local time.  Please extend time zone support to the entire product.

---

Emails use the interface of {{NavigableField}} to render the changed values in emails. Specifically, they are given {{GenericValue}} objects for ChildChangeItem entries, which are rendered via {{VelocityHelper#getPrettyFieldString}}, which will call out to the {{Field}}'s equivalent method.

Here's the rub: 
# The changelog values are only strings. They don't have type data, so we don't know whether we're dealing with a value that needs parsing or not.
# The NavigableField rendering methods only accepts an i18nHelper object, but not a locale or timezone value. 
# NavigableField is a Public API, so it's possible people are implementing and extending this.

These three things combined mean that, at present, we have no real means of parsing the values for a user's timezone.

To add time zone support in emails, we need to address the more fundamental problems listed above.
fields.summary: Add time-zone support for rendering date fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28937].
  {panel}

The new inline editor is activated by a single click into the field.

It would be a good enhancement if the inline editor can be activated by a double-click on a field.
That would prevent many mistakes when you just like to select a text but you activate the editor instead by mistake.

Maybe it can be configurable in Administration section to allow activation of the inline editor either by single or by double-click.
!InlineEdit_configuration.png!
fields.summary: Allow the inline editing of fields by double-clicking (instead of single-click)

Thank you!

Greetings,
Sebastian Lüdtke

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28926].
  {panel}

Now there are 3 ways to design/change workflows:
* XML
* Text Designer
* Grafical Designer

BIG problem is that each of this way has limitations that prevent from using as the one-and-only:
1) I cant design/change draft workflows with XML so i have all control on workflow itself but forced to create new workflow instead of changing current, create new schema with new workflow and then migrate project to new schema - very unfrendly 

2) Text designer doesn't allow to create global and common transitions but allow to modify them if they exist in workflow
3) Grafical designer allow to create common and global transition but doesn't allow to modify them ( conditions, validators and post-functions )

so i need constantly switch between text and grafical designers to add/change common transitions

It would be very good to add absent functionality to text and/or grafical workflow designer, since i understand that limitations of XML is some kind of *insurance* from easy damage to issues
fields.summary: Increase functionality of text and/or graphical workflow designer
Leap Second which caused JIRA to crash and unable to startup
As an administrator, I would like to prevent the Activity Stream gadget from trying to connect outside of our network

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28920].
  {panel}

Steps to replicate:

1. Create a _Cascading Select_ custom field:

!casc_1.png!

2. Create an Issue using this custom field. After that, search for this issue using the _simple searching_:

!casc_2.png!

3. Change to _advanced searching_. The JQL will show the custom fields IDs instead the name.

!casc_3.png!
fields.summary: JQL should show the name of custom field when change from simple search to advanced
Systray notification popup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28917].
  {panel}

As of Lion, OSX no longer bundles Quicktime with Java. We need to update the Mac applet to use something else.
It would be awesome to rewrite this using not-java-applet.
{quote} Penny: Even Flash would be better {quote} Or HTML

*Steps to Reproduce:*
After updating OS X (Lion) to the latest Java available through the Software Update, you get:
{noformat}
java version "1.6.0_37"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_37-b06-434-11M3909)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 20.12-b01-434, mixed mode)
{noformat}

When you open an issue and go to the _Attach Screenshot_ option, it asks you to Update the Java Applet and sends you to http://www.java.com/en/download/mac_download.jsp?locale=en if you agree to install. After installing it if you check Firefox Add-ons the plugin is:

!Screen Shot 2012-11-07 at 10.07.18 AM.png!

When you go once again to the _Attach Screenshot_ option, the Applet loads but nothing happens when you click on the _Paste_ button.

*Expected Results:*
Screenshots should be pasted and added to JIRA Issues.

*Actual Results:*
Nothing happens, no errors in the logs or in the screen.

*Workaround:*

Revert the Java Applet update as described in this Apple KB: http://support.apple.com/kb/HT5559?viewlocale=en_US&locale=en_US

*Another Workaround:*
Use the [Attach Screenshot Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.plugins.jira-html5-attach-images]
fields.summary: Screenshot applet does not work on Mac
Expose additional save-on-blur functionality
Permalink button from a filter is not a permalink to filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28909].
  {panel}

I have two issues that are duplicates
I open one
then I open the other
I click on More Actions and choose link
on the link page, I click on the drop down in the 'Issue' text box
Since the issue that I want to link is one of the last issues that I viewed, I expect to see that issue as one of the first issues on the list that results
But it is nowhere to be found

The list that I see makes no sense, given what I have been doing for the last two days.  It is either sorted wrong (e.g., oldest issue viewed first), or is being taken from somewhere that makes no sense.
fields.summary: The list of issues in the 'Issue' dropdown in the link dialog makes no sense

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28893].
  {panel}

Related to JRA-28470 we want to complete the loop on this.

When restoring data, it's too easy to forget to add the jvm args to disable the incoming mail services.

If you are restoring a test / staging server, you can inadvertently end up pulling emails out of your inbox before the production JIRA has a chance to get to them. This causes a substantial amount of missing data from a production instance and can be difficult to track down (since it'll work for some emails, but not all, and it's purely based on which JIRA gets in first).

Essentially, just like the outgoing options, we need an option to disable incoming mail when restoring data.
fields.summary: Option to Disable Incoming mail during XML import
Update text on mail setup page
Label axes on graphs

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

* Free/Paid/Both
* Plugin Developer
* (other information, possibly)

I am creating an issue for this, it might be worth investigating.
fields.summary: Filter UPM search based on plugin characteristics

Please help me to resolve the issue.
fields.summary: crashing during Reindexing
Project/Version listener
Notify Users is not hidden when Create Users is not selected on Create Issue mail handlers
Access to MAYA under GMIS EMEA Technology project
Upgrade to support tools plugin 3.0.8
Disable irrelevant project roles from project administrator update
Add missing handler parameters to 5.0.x docs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28870].
  {panel}

Lost the "Assign to Me" link on the create forms to facilitate assigning tickets to the person currently working on the ticket (edit/create).

I've already checked all the permissions and settings that was supposed to be configured to get this working. (Including the Jira Operations Plugin that is with the View Issue Ops Bar Assign Link module enabled).

!create-issue.png!

This was available pre-v5.1.

!old-create-issue.png!
fields.summary: Missing "Assign to Me" functionality
UPM should check if plugins that require license are entitled to upgrades
Add a counter on the number of linked issues
Clarify JIRA JEE/J2EE compliance
Option to clear the log or create new log file once the current log file reach certain size.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28859].
  {panel}

Provide a banner, similar to the index required banner for admins, when an instance has reached End Of Life status and needs to be upgraded to continue support.

Considerations:
* Check if they are able to upgrade to a newer version based on their license
* May need to check PAC for EOL status due to our EOL policy
* Should be dismissible by admins who choose not to upgrade
* Should explain EOL and support policies and / or provide links to them and MAC for renewing.
fields.summary: Add an EOL alert for Admins
